intro: Placolobium cambodianum, commonly known as the Cambodian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia, particularly Cambodia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
